welcome.title: Welcome to AEO Dashboard
welcome.desc: Answer Engine Optimization (AEO) helps your website appear in AI-generated answers — from ChatGPT and Google AI Overviews to Perplexity and Bing Copilot. This tour will walk you through every tool so you know exactly how to use each one.

sidebar.title: Sidebar Navigation
sidebar.desc: Use the sidebar to switch between all the tools in the app. Each tool handles a specific part of your AEO workflow. Pro tip: press number keys 1–9 to jump between views instantly, or press ⌘K (Ctrl+K) to open the Command Palette for fast search and navigation.

project-switcher.title: Your Project
project-switcher.desc: Each project tracks one website's AEO optimization. All your checklist progress, metrics, and settings are project-scoped. You can create multiple projects for different websites and switch between them here.

progress.title: Progress Tracking
progress.desc: The progress bar shows your overall AEO completion percentage across all 7 phases. The colored phase badges below break it down — aim to get all phases to 100%. This gives you a quick snapshot of where you stand and what needs attention.

dashboard.title: Dashboard
dashboard.desc: Your command center for AEO. View key stat cards, progress charts, and phase breakdowns at a glance. Switch between sub-tabs (Overview, Citations, Prompts, Chatbots) to see different metric angles. This is where you check your overall AEO health.

checklist.title: AEO Guide
checklist.desc: Your step-by-step roadmap with 99 tasks across 7 phases. Check items off as you complete them — progress saves automatically. Each task has a "Learn more" button with detailed documentation and an action button that takes you directly to the relevant tool. Start with Phase 1 to audit your technical foundation.

analyzer.title: Analyzer
analyzer.desc: Enter any URL and the AI will scan it for AEO readiness — checking schema markup, content structure, technical SEO, and authority signals. You'll get a score from 0–100 with specific, actionable recommendations. This should be your starting point: analyze your site to get a baseline score.

writer.title: Content Writer
writer.desc: AI-powered content creation specifically optimized for AEO. Generate FAQ pages, how-to guides, product descriptions, and other content formats that AI engines love to cite. The writer structures content with clear headings, concise answers, and proper formatting for maximum AI visibility.

schema.title: Schema Generator
schema.desc: Generate JSON-LD structured data markup for your pages. Schema is one of the most important AEO factors — it tells AI engines exactly what your content means. Select a schema type (FAQPage, HowTo, Article, Product, etc.), fill in the fields, and get valid JSON-LD ready to paste into your site.

testing.title: Testing
testing.desc: Test real queries against AI engines (ChatGPT, Perplexity, Google AI, Bing Copilot, Claude) to see if your content appears in their answers. Track which queries you're winning and which need work. This is how you validate that your optimizations are actually working.

metrics-monitoring.title: Metrics & Monitoring
metrics-monitoring.desc: Track your AEO performance over time with detailed analytics. The Monitoring tab watches for issues in real-time, while Metrics shows trends in citations, visibility, and traffic. Connect Google Search Console and GA4 in Settings to pull in real performance data from your website.

docs.title: Documentation
docs.desc: Full documentation for every feature and every checklist task. The App Guide tab explains each tool in detail, AEO Reference has comprehensive docs for all 99 tasks, and FAQ answers common questions. Search across everything or browse by phase.

settings.title: Settings
settings.desc: Configure your project details, invite team members with role-based access (Owner, Admin, Editor, Viewer), and connect integrations — Google Search Console, Google Analytics 4, and Webflow. Set your Anthropic API key here — it's required for the Analyzer and AI-powered features.

get-started.title: You're Ready!
get-started.desc: Here's your game plan: First, go to Settings and set your API key. Then open the AEO Guide and start with Phase 1 to audit your technical foundation. Use the Analyzer to scan your website and get a baseline score. From there, work through the phases — each task links directly to the tool you need. Good luck!

newProject.title: New Project

newProject.helpText: Each project tracks a website's AEO optimization progress, metrics, and competitive analysis.

webhooks.title: Webhooks & Integrations
webhooks.description: Send automated notifications to external tools when events happen in your project.
webhooks.compatibilityInfo: Works with Slack, Discord, Zapier, Make, n8n, and any CORS-friendly webhook endpoint. For Jira, Asana, or other APIs, use Zapier or Make as a bridge.
webhooks.name: Name
webhooks.emptyState: No webhooks configured. Connect to Slack, Discord, Zapier, or any webhook endpoint.

step0.title: Tell us about your business
step0.desc: This helps us tailor recommendations to your industry.
step0.whyMattersDesc: Your answers directly shape every recommendation, schema suggestion, and content strategy in this dashboard. The more accurate your profile, the more relevant and actionable your AEO roadmap becomes.
step0.countriesHint: (optional — select one or more for local targeting)

step1.title: Who are you targeting?
step1.desc: Understanding your audience and goals helps us prioritize the right AEO strategies.

step2.title: Which AI engines matter most?
step2.desc: Select the AI platforms you want to optimize for. We'll focus your metrics and testing on these.

step3.title: Your content & experience
step3.desc: This helps us customize your checklist priority order.

step4.title: About your business
step4.desc: Help us understand your business so we can give you specific, actionable advice.
step4.businessDescHint: The more detail you provide, the more personalized your schema suggestions, content strategies, and recommendations will be.
step4.businessDescPlaceholder: Briefly describe what your business does and who you serve. E.g.: We're a cloud hosting company serving small businesses across Europe, offering managed hosting and API integrations.
step4.servicesHint: List your main offerings — this helps us suggest the right schema types and content topics for your business.
step4.servicesPlaceholder: e.g., cloud hosting, API integrations, consulting services

step5.title: Current technical state
step5.desc: This helps us suggest the right starting point for your optimization.
step5.schemaLabel: Do you have schema markup on your site?
step5.cadenceLabel: How often do you update content?
